title: Manager, Production Management, Live Action - Japan
overview: The Manager, Production Management, Live Action - Japan position involves managing internal and third party co-production Netflix Original titles from a physical production perspective in Japan, including establishing relationships, reviewing budgets, and supporting best production practices.
description:
We are seeking an experienced Production Executive to join the Production Management team to manage both internal and third party co-production Netflix Original titles from a physical production perspective.Â 

Responsibilities include establishing and curating relations with producers and production companies, reviewing budgets, and supporting/suggesting best production practices. The position will work closely with our Creative, Post Production, and other internal teams along with producers to ensure efficient delivery.

The Role
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, able to exercise good judgment, initiative, and has an in-depth knowledge of Japanese live action and production process.

extras.title: Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
content: Pre Production/Setup of Show: Work with Finance, Legal, Creative, Post, VFX, Music and external production teams on establishing key production schedules and workflows and maximizing budget to spend as much on screen as possible

Budgeting: Work with Showrunners and Line Producers to prepare and vet show budgets and schedules, providing feedback internally and externally on viability and risks; Review creative/scripts and begin defining the budgets; Collaborate with internal teams and our production partners to lock the budget; Track and manage all costs, keeping stakeholders apprised of the status; Review cost reports and trackers on a bi-weekly basis; Help ensure that productions run smoothly, meet deadlines and stay within budget

Scheduling: Create/Help inform and draft production and post schedule; Collaborate with internal teams (including Post, VFX, Music) and external production team to lock schedule; Troubleshoot and communicate all changes to schedule to internal/external teams

Staffing/Vendors: Lead or assist with search and hire of key production staff; Determine key vendors to accommodate creative vision and relationships, tax incentives, budget needs, location issues; Help maintain/curate preferred vendor list
Content Management: Set up and attend key creative approval sessions; Set up and schedule legal clearance reviews with Legal Department

extras.title: Qualifications:
content: 10 Years + experience with Japanese live action production
Ability to handle a fast-paced environment simultaneously supervising several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery)
Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both HDR and 4K productions, within a Japanese live action production environment
Access to a long roster of high-quality vendors and talent throughout Japan
Ability to respond after-hours for important, timely or urgent matters
Team-player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting
Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
Willingness to travel, as external conditions permits
Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current production process and gear
Must be fluent in Japanese. Fluency in English is a plus.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail
